snippet: After agreeing to ensure that police stops were conducted legally, Philadelphia officials say aggressive crime fighting is accompanied by a respect for civil rights.
abstract: Philadelphia officials defend their overhaul of the city's stop-and-frisk policy, effort that has won praise even from the civil rights lawyers who filed a 2010 class-action lawsuit accusing officers of stopping minorities without sufficient cause; officials contend that they have reached an appropriate balance between aggressive crime fighting and a respect for civil rights.
lead_paragraph: After agreeing to ensure that police stops were conducted legally, Philadelphia officials say aggressive crime fighting is accompanied by a respect for civil rights.

headline.main: Philadelphia Defends Policy on Frisking, With Limits
headline.print_headline: Philadelphia Defends Policy On Frisking, With Limits
